Documentation¶

Main¶

main.get_dl_model(network_type, load_param, is_pretrained, is_saved)¶

Setup input size and compile the model architecture, according to network_type

Parameters

  • network_type – Deep Learning architecture: unet, deeplabv3, so on

  • load_param – The parameters from the network specified. The parameters are pre-stablished in settings.py file

  • is_pretrained – a boolean, if True, the model will be compiled with a pre-trained weights, also

established in settings.py file [output_checkpoints] :param is_saved: a boolean, if True, the model after built, will be saved in a pre-stablished path, set in settings.py file [save_model_dir] :return: a compiled keras model

Source:

  • https://github.com/divamgupta/image-segmentation-keras

main.main(network_type, is_training, is_predicting)¶

Initiate the processing: execute training and predictions according to is_training and is_predicting variables

Parameters

  • network_type – Deep Learning architecture: unet, deeplabv3, so on

  • is_training – a boolean, if True, the input samples are then loaded, the specified model is compiled and

the training is performed :param is_predicting: a boolean, if True, the deep learning inferences is performed according to the model specified

Sources:

  • validation_steps and steps_per_epoch: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51885739/

how-to-properly-set-steps-per-epoch-and-validation-steps-in-keras

DL models [UNet]¶

class dl.model.unet.UNet(input_size, is_pretrained, is_saved)¶

Python class intended for building the model UNet, mainly using Keras framework

Source:

  • https://github.com/usnistgov/semantic-segmentation-unet/blob/master/UNet/model.py

  • https://github.com/keras-team/keras-io/blob/master/examples/vision/oxford_pets_image_segmentation.py

build_model()¶

According to the UNet deep architecture presented in https://lmb.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/ Publications/2015/RFB15a/, the method returns the exact model based on input dimensions and other parameters set in settings.py

Source:

  • https://github.com/usnistgov/semantic-segmentation-unet

  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53322488/implementing-u-net-for-multi-class-road-segmentation

conv_block(tensor, n_filters, size=3, padding='same', initializer='he_normal')¶

Convolution layers setup. Build convolutional layer according to the tensor and params

Parameters

  • tensor – the input to the pooling

  • n_filters – the exactly number of filter

  • size – the squared kernel size. Default value is 3

  • padding – type of padding. Default value is same

  • initializer – type of the initializer. Default value is he_normal

Return conv

the resultant tensor after two consecutive convolutions

deconv_block(tensor, n_filters, residual, size=3, stride=2, padding='same')¶

Deconvolution layer setup. Build deconvolutional layer according to the tensor and params

Parameters

  • tensor – the input to the pooling

  • n_filters – the exactly number of filter

  • residual –

  • size – the squared kernel size. Default value is 3

  • stride – type of the initializer. Default value is he_normal

  • padding – type of padding. Default value is same

Return deconv

the resultant tensor after deconvolution (transposition) operation

get_batch_size()¶
Return batch_size

the respective model’s batch_size. Previously defined in settings.py

get_callbacks()¶
Return callbacks

the model’s callback

get_inputs()¶
Return inputs

the input’s dimension. Previously defined in settings.py

get_learning_rate()¶
Return learning_rate

the respective optimizer’s learning rate. Previously defined in settings.py

get_loss()¶
Return loss_fn

the respective loss function

get_model()¶
Return model

the respective compiled model

get_num_channels()¶
Return number_channels

the number of samples’s bands

get_num_classes()¶
Return number_classes

the respective number of classes. Previously defined in settings.py

get_optimizer()¶
Return optimizer

the respective optimizer. Default is Adam

get_pooling_size()¶
Return pooling_size

the respective pooling size.

pool(tensor, pool_size, stride)¶

Pooling layer setup. Build pooling layer according to the tensor and pool_size

Parameters

  • tensor – the input to the pooling

  • pool_size – the dimension of the pooling

  • stride – the stride

Return output

the resultant tensor after pooling

Input helper¶

class input.helper.Helper(batch_size, img_size, input_img_paths, target_img_paths)¶

Helper to iterate over the data (as Numpy arrays)

Sources:

  • https://keras.io/examples/vision/oxford_pets_image_segmentation/

  • https://stanford.edu/~shervine/blog/keras-how-to-generate-data-on-the-fly

  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43884463/how-to-convert-rgb-image-to-one-hot-encoded-3d-array-based-on-color-using-numpy

  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54011487/typeerror-unsupported-operand-types-for-image-and-int

get_list_images()¶
Return list_image

return the list of absolute path to the images

Output inferences¶

Output poligonization¶

class output.poligonize.Poligonize¶

Perform poligonization [raster to vector] operations, despite the utils methods for it

create_shapefile(segmented_image_path, classes, original_image_path, output_vector_path, vector_type='ESRI Shapefile')¶

Perform operations to read original image [remote sensing data], and from its metadata, create a new vector file according to the classes specified in settings.py file

Parameters

  • segmented_image_path – absolute path of the image segmentation/classification result. A raster [JPG, PNG, TIFF, so on] version from the inference operation

  • classes – the list of classes and respectively colors

  • original_image_path – the original raster image path, where the geographic metadata is read and transfer to the output

  • output_vector_path – the output path, where the new geographic format is saved

  • vector_type – default value is ESRI Shapefile (most commom), but GeoJSON is accepted

get_classes_gt(segmented, classes)¶

Read all pixels and check if there is more classes than the ones specified in classes dict

Parameters

  • segmented – absolute path of the image segmentation/classification result. A raster [JPG, PNG, TIFF, so on] version from the inference operation

  • classes – the list of classes and respectively colors

Returns

a list with all classes presented in the image (i.e. only if within classes dict as well)

get_image_by_class(segmented, classes, key)¶

In some cases, the segmented image might present variations classes’s color, which could led in a wrong reading of the quantity of classes presented in the segmentation. Thus, According to the classes dict, the method returns a new image, with a filtered color classes

Parameters

  • segmented – absolute path of the image segmentation/classification result. A raster [JPG, PNG, TIFF, so on] version from the inference operation

  • classes – the list of classes and respectively colors

  • key – the string class name

Returns

a new image, with a filtered color class

polygonize(segmented_image_path, classes, original_image_path, output_vector_path)¶

Turn a JPG, PNG images in a geographic format, such as ESRI Shapefile or GeoJSON. The image must to be in the exact colors specified in settings.py - DL_PARAM[‘classes’]

Parameters

  • segmented_image_path – the segmented multiclass image path

  • classes – the list of classes and respectively colors

  • original_image_path – the original raster image path, where the geographic metadata is read and transfer to the output

  • output_vector_path – the output path, where the new geographic format is saved

Output slicer¶

class output.slicer.Slicer¶
merge_images(paths, max_width, max_height, complete_path_to_merged_prediction)¶

Merge the result of each tile in a single image [reverse operation of slice method]

Parameters

  • paths – list of absolute paths

  • max_width – the desired tile width

  • max_height – the desired tile height

  • complete_path_to_merged_prediction –

slice_bitmap(file, width, height, output_folder)¶

Open the non-geographic image file, and crop it equally with dimensions of width x height, placing it in output_folder. The remaining borders is also cropped and saved in the folder

Parameters

  • file – absolute image path [oversized image]

  • width – the desired tile width

  • height – the desired tile height

  • output_folder – the destination folder of the tiles/slices

Return paths

a list of absolute paths, regarding each tile cropped

slice_geographic(file, width, height, output_folder)¶

Open the image file, and crop it equally with dimensions of width x height, placing it in output_folder. The remaining borders is also cropped and saved in the folder

Parameters

  • file – absolute image path [oversized image]

  • width – the desired tile width

  • height – the desired tile height

  • output_folder – the destination folder of the tiles/slices

Return paths

a list of absolute paths, regarding each tile cropped

Utils¶

class utils.utils.Utils¶

Utils method for IO and image processing processing

flush_files(folder_path)¶

Remove all files inside paths

Parameters

folder_path – absolute path of a folder

flush_list_of_paths(paths)¶

Remove all files from the paths in list

Parameters

paths – list of absolute paths to be removed from filesystem
